Comment: Arash starts with the queen's pawn opening.
Queens pawn game.
Queens pawn gambit. A rather safe gambit, in my opinion.
I respond with the Queen's gambit declined. I'll also be honest with you here: I don't know anything about openings beyond this move. From here out I'm going with my best judgement.
My guess is he played this to prevent Bb4.
"Develop the least developed piece to the best possible square"
He develops his knight as well.
I develop my second knight.
Knights royal!
I do this to castle, as well as defend against Bg5.
I'm pretty sure this is a good move...
Knight: Go away or die.
Or trade off first...
I was very happy to do this move because, until now, my LSB was completely trapped. I think the trade favored me...
He's trying to invade, but I think this is pointless, and a wast of time. After I press the f pawn, not only will white's DSB be forced to die, but whites f6 knight won't be able to go to e5 or g5.
Naturally, I push.
He retreats...
And I trade an inactive knight for an active bishop.
Gotta take back with something...
King safety.
